data.title: International Standards Organization (ISO) Definition | TLDR
data.meta_description: What Is the International Standards Organization (ISO)? International Standards Organization (ISO) Definition & Meaning
data.text:
The International Organization for Standardization, commonly known as ISO, is an independent international body that develops and publishes standards to ensure the quality, safety, efficiency, and interoperability of products, services, and systems across various industries. Established in 1947, ISO is a non-governmental organization composed of representatives from national standards bodies of different countries. Its headquarters are located in Geneva, Switzerland. The organization's mission is to facilitate international trade and innovation by providing a common framework for quality and safety standards that are recognized globally.
